security: Disclosing unsubstantiated rumors that the CIA organized the murder of President Kennedy could severely damage the Agency's reputation and compromise its ability to operate effectively. Quoting directly: "Note that in the section pencilled in red rumors are referred which suggest that kind it was the Agency to organize the murder of President Kennedy."
summary: Arthur P. Iorio forwards a clipping of an article from the Italian Communist Party weekly Rinascita, which references rumors suggesting the CIA organized the murder of President Kennedy, to CI Staff member Birch O'Neil.
summary_one_paragraph: On March 26, 1964, Arthur P. Iorio, WE/4/INT, sent a routing and record sheet with an attached article, "The Kennedy Murder and the Secret Services of the USA," to CI Staff member Birch O'Neil in Room 2603. The article, written by Gianfranco Corsini and published in the March 7 issue of the Italian Communist Party weekly Rinascita, includes rumors suggesting that the CIA was responsible for President Kennedy's assassination, as highlighted in a section marked with red pencil.
title: Clipping of article "The Kennedy Murder and the Secret Services of the USA"
